result.execSummary:
The defendant DILLON R SIMMONS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence, concurrent to #21CF369.  Credit for 137 days.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, concurrent to #21CF369.  Credit for 137 days.

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.   Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Pay all fees and costs.
Follow all rules of department.
Counseling as deemed appropriate including COMPAS assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Provide DNA sample and fingerprint if not previously submitted.

for bail bond review

The defendant, Dillon R. Simmons, is to be released to a bed at the Mooring House Treatment Center in Appleton Wisconsin, for inpatient treatment with a bed availability date of 09/14/2022 at 10:00 am. 
The defendant is to report to the Mooring House for inpatient treatment at 10:00 am on 09/14/2022, and that he not leave the facility until his treatment is complete.
The defendant shall provide proof of his acceptance at the Mooring House and shall provide documentation as to the treatment plan and duration of the inpatient treatment.
The bond shall revert back to $5,000 cash upon discharge from the facility for any reason.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license or valid registration.

03:18 PM Defendant DILLON R SIMMONS in court.  Eric Sparr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DILLON R SIMMONS appeared by video means.  Advised of rights.  The Defendant does qualify for the Public Defender but they haven't found an attorney to take this case yet.  The Defendant waives his/her right to an attorney for this hearing.  Hearing on defendant's oral motion to amend bond, requests a signature bond.  The State objects to a reduction of bond now but may reconsider once a treatment plan in place.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  The Court will not amend bond.  Record closed @ 3:26.
